meanings.definition: A substance that thickens or solidifies when subjected to pressure or stress.
meanings.sent1: The dilatants in the mixture made it hard to stir.
meanings.sent2: The dilatants in the paint caused it to become thicker as I applied pressure.
meanings.sent3: The dilatants in the glue seemed to play a trick on me, getting thicker when I pressed it.
meanings.sent4: The dilatants in the clay transformed it into a solid mass when I squeezed it tightly.
meanings.sent5: I learned about dilatants in science class; they are like magical substances that change when you push on them.

meanings.definition: A material that exhibits non-Newtonian fluid behavior, becoming more viscous under shear stress.
meanings.sent1: When I pressed the dilatants, they became thicker and harder to move.
meanings.sent2: The dilatants in the lotion made it feel thicker on my skin when I rubbed it in.
meanings.sent3: I accidentally sat on the dilatants, and they seemed to turn into a sticky mess under me.
meanings.sent4: The dilatants in the shampoo made it feel like washing my hair with honey when I squeezed the bottle.
meanings.sent5: The dilatants in the slime toy made it feel like playing with a thick, gooey substance that changed as I squeezed it.
